meanings.definition: (verb) To obtain or achieve by luck or chance.
meanings.sent1: She fluked a perfect score on the test without studying.
meanings.sent2: He fluked finding a rare coin in the sand at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The magician fluked pulling a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The team fluked winning the championship game with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent5: The student fluked guessing the correct answer on every question.

meanings.sent1: The whale's fluked tail was magnificent as it dove into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The fluked fins of the fish helped it glide effortlessly through the water.
meanings.sent3: The fluked design of the boat made it stand out in the harbor.
meanings.sent4: The fluked pattern on the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The fluked appearance of the cloud resembled a giant feather in the sky.

meanings.definition: (noun) A stroke of luck or chance.
meanings.sent1: Winning the lottery was a complete fluke for him.
meanings.sent2: It was a fluke that she found her lost keys in the park.
meanings.sent3: The meeting being canceled was a lucky fluke for him as he needed more time to prepare.
meanings.sent4: The discovery of the rare flower in the forest was a delightful fluke.
meanings.sent5: Their unexpected reunion at the airport was a wonderful fluke of fate.
